definition[0]: to start talking or doing something quickly and confidently, especially without thinking about it first
example[0]: It’s a difficult situation. You can’t just plunge in and put everything right.
example[1]: ‘I don’t agree, ’ she said, plunging into the conversation.
definition[1]: to jump or dive into water
example[2]: He stripped off and plunged into the sea.
definition[2]: to push something firmly and deeply into something else
example[3]: He opened the bag and plunged his hand in.
example[4]: Plunge the pasta into boiling water.
example[5]: Repeatedly she plunged the knife into his chest.
